name: REDDER
description:
Redder is essentially what Metroid would have been if it had been created by Stanley Kubrick. ~It's Nice That




REDDER is an open-world game with 180 screens in nine areas to explore. First released as a web game in 2010, it was doing things indie games just weren't doing yet. This new desktop version can store up to three simultaneous save files.

CAUTION: This game contains strobing effects.



"If you're interested in level design, or how a few, simple, interlocking gameplay concepts are developed to their potential, REDDER is a must play....Or just wander, like I did, losing yourself in a vast story, told without a single word." ~PC Power Play

"It's uncomfortable. It exposes the strings holding the world together, it completely breaks your immersion with the world and it's all the more powerful if that world is worth caring about in the first place, like it is in REDDER." ~Terry Cavanagh



"REDDER is perhaps my most-loved accomplishment because it is both A Real
Videogame and anna anthropy bullshit at the same time." ~anna anthropy
